From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2024 Indian thriller drama film
This article needs to be updated. The reason given is: It is unclear if this film has been released or not.. Please help update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information. (March 2024)
The film 'Accident or Conspiracy Godhra', based on the Godhra incident, was scheduled to be released on march 1, but due to the film not getting the censor certificate, the film could not be released on the previously scheduled release date.The film 'Accident or Conspiracy Godhra' is a film based on the report of the Nanavati-Mehta Commission formed to investigate the Godhra incident. According to the information received, Censor Board officials are investigating whether this film is based on the report of the Nanavati-Mehta Commission. Are the events shown in the film recorded in the Nanavati-Mehta Commission report? Even after examining these facts, the film will be given a censor certificate.
In the film it is shown what was the truth of the Godhra incident. What is the story behind the Godhra train fire? One day, in a fit of rage, some people set the train on fire, or it was a pre-planned conspiracy. It is being claimed about this film that the truth of what has come to light till now through the media regarding the Godhra incident is something else.

Accident or Conspiracy: Godhra is a 2024 Hindi-language drama film produced under the banner of OM Trinetra Films and Artverse Studios directed by M.K Shivaaksh.[1][2][3] The drama is based on the events surrounding the 2002 Godhra train fire in Gujarat, India, which later led to the 2002 Gujarat riots shortly afterward.


Synopsis[edit]
The film is based on the report issued by the Nanavati-Mehta Commission,[4] which was set up to investigate the Godhra train fire.[5] The film aims to uncover what happened in Godhra. Was it a spontaneous act where some individuals set fire to the train in a fit of frenzy, or was it a pre-planned conspiracy?[6]
